paper_abstract: This paper tightens previous information combining bounds on the performance of iterative decoding of binary low-density parity-check (LDPC) codes over binary-input symmetric-output channels by tracking the probability of erroneous bit in conjunction with mutual information. Evaluation of the new bounds as well as of other known bounds on different LDPC ensembles demonstrates sensitivity of the finite dimensional iterative bounds to lambda(2), the fraction of edges connected to degree 2 variable nodes.
paper_title: Constrained information combining: Theory and applications for LDPC coded systems
